abstract.text: StoreHelper is a Swift Package Manager (SPM) package that enables developers using Xcode 13 - 15 to easily add in-app purchase support to iOS 15 - 17 and macOS 12 - 14 SwiftUI apps.
Default config values used by StoreHelper. May be overriden by using a Configuration.plist file in your app’s main bundle.

Information on the result of unwrapping a transaction
StoreHelper is a Swift Package Manager (SPM) package that enables developers using Xcode 13 - 15 to easily add in-app purchase support to iOS 15 - 17 and macOS 12 - 14 SwiftUI apps.
KeychainHelper provides methods for working with collections of
in the keychain.
Holds information on a subscription group and the associated subscription products.
Information on a transaction update (e.g. subscription renewal, cancellation, etc.)
Shows a count badge with the number of times a consumable has been purchased.
Displays a consumable, non-consumable product’s price on a button that enables purchasing. If the product is a subscription,
the price and renewal period is displayed on a button that enables purchasing. If a subscription has one or more eligible offers
then these are displayed in preference to the standard price and renewal period.
Provides methods for reading the contents of the product definition property list (e.g.
The structure of the product definition property list may take one of two alternative formats, as described below.
Extended information about a subscription product. Used for displaying info to the user.
Information about a subscription product before it’s been purchased, including introductory and promotional offers.
A consumable product id and associated count value.
Constants used in support of App Store operations.
Displays an error.
Displays information on a consumable or non-consumable purchase.
Informational logging notifications issued by StoreHelper
Displays a small image that gives a visual clue to the product’s purchase state.
Displays a single row of product information for the main content List.

The structure of the product definition property list may take one of two alternative formats, as described below.
Displays either the standard purchase price and renewal period for a subscription, or available introductory
or promotional offers.
Summarized information about a non-consumable purchase.

The product’s price is also displayed in the localized currency.

Terms and conditions of usage.
StoreHelper encapsulates StoreKit2 in-app purchase functionality and makes it easy to work with the App Store.
Displays links for terms of service and privacy policy
ViewModel for
. Enables purchasing.
The status of a StoreKit1 or StoreKit2 subscription
We use Apple’s unified logging system to log errors, notifications and general messages.
This system works on simulators and real devices for both debug and release builds.
You can view the logs in the Console app by selecting the test device in the left console pane.
If running on the simulator, select the machine the simulator is running on. Type your app’s
bundle identifier into the search field and then narrow the results by selecting “SUBSYSTEM”
from the search field’s filter. Logs also appear in Xcode’s console in the same manner as
print statements.
Displays text for the price of a consumable or non-consumable product.
Support for StoreKit1. Tells the observer that a user initiated an in-app purchase direct from the App Store,
rather than via the app itself. StoreKit2 does not (yet) provide support for direct purchases, so we need to
use StoreKit1. This is a requirement in order to promote in-app purchases on the App Store. If your app doesn’t
have a class that implements
and the
and
delegate methods then you’ll get an error when you submit the app
to the App Store and you have IAP promotions.
Initializes the
view, which is responsible for displaying a list of available products, along with purchase buttons and a button
to enable users to manually restore previous purchases.
Displays a single row of product information for the main content List.
An optional promo id and localized purchase price and renewal period in a format that may be displayed to the user.
ViewModel for
. Enables gathering of purchase or subscription information.
The state of a purchase.
Allows the user to trigger a complete refresh of the product list and rebuild the purchase cache. The same action
may be triggered using the “pull-to-refresh” gesture on the product list.
Information about the highest service level product in a subscription group a user is subscribed to.
